titleStmt.title: Letter from Slade Kendrick to John G. Neihardt, September 30, 1960
titleStmt.author: Kendrick, M. Slade (Myron Slade)

publicationStmt.authority: The Papers of John G. Neihardt

distributor.name: Center for Digital Research in the Humanities

bibl.author: Kendrick, M. Slade (Myron Slade)
bibl.title: Letter from Slade Kendrick to John G. Neihardt

revisionDesc.change: Weakly, Laura K. transcription and encoding

div1.p: Dear John: — Excellent! By all means come Saturday the 15th. Just notify me of the time & place of your arrival, and I shall be there.

The Mohawk Airline, which leaves from Newark, N.J. is the quicker of the two ways to come. But I understand that the planes are not pressurized. Note And now I must take this back. I have just called and learn that some are pressurized, some not.
The other way of coming is by bus. Personally, though this trip is more tiring, I like and always take it. The bus goes through the Pennsylvania Mts. One sees a lot of country.

How fine that the "Westerns" are having you. It will also be nice for you to have the opportunity to see the city. If you are interested in Art Galleries, the Glick at 20th & 5th Ave is both easy to get to & Wonderful. The Cloisters a treasure house of the Middle Ages, is a favorite with me. The Uptown 8th Ave express marked AAA reaches 190th at the entrance in 20-25 minutes.
We shall be so glad to have you. The fall colors will be ready for your inspection
